page.title: 02Rural Area of Perthshire
page.content: This is a rural area in central Scotland & at the foothills of higher hills of 500-670, it is predominantly a farming and woodland area. The woodland is fairly equally divided between the deciduous forest & fairly recently planted coniferous area. Generally the areas are small. There are some 13 farms in the area.They have mainly dairy cattle,grass,crops, potatoes and in one case some summer fruit. There is a castle, privately owned and lived in and two large residential houses. Apart from the farms there are farm cottages, a few modern houses and other estate houses. There are no major roads but several minor, north-south road, often linked by paths and tracks.It is also crossed by a few small rivers. It is a gently undulating are with open views on northern boundary towards hills.
